attributes.description:
The garage will remain open during construction, and more parking is also available at Quincy Adams and in 2 surface lots at Braintree.

Riders can consider parking at the Quincy Adams Garage. Follow @mbta_parking on Twitter for real-time availability reports weekday mornings.

More than 300 spots are also available at Braintree Station in 2 surface lots off of Ivory Street.
attributes.header: Beginning February 10, 2020 up to 400 of the 1,197 parking spots at the Braintree Garage will close for concrete replacement. This project acceleration will allow the spaces to open 16 months earlier than planned. https://www.mbta.com/south-shore-garages
attributes.short_header: Beginning 02/10/20 up to 400 of the 1,197 spots at Braintree Garage will close for construction. https://www.mbta.com/south-shore-garages

attributes.description:
For access to Braintree Station, travel down to the first floor and use the pedestrian crosswalk to enter the station at the street level.

This construction is part of the South Shore Parking Garages Improvements and Renovations Project. The pedestrian bridge will be replaced by a new garage lobby featuring elevators and stairwells.

Affected routes:
Red Line
North Quincy-Braintree shuttle
230

Middleborough/Lakeville Line

attributes.description: A shuttle bus will be available to transport customers between Roxbury Crossing and Ruggles. To exit, exit the train at Ruggles and find station personnel or use a station call box to request the shuttle bus to Roxbury Crossing. To board, find station personnel or use a station call box at Roxbury Crossing to request the shuttle bus to Ruggles. Alternatively, customers may also use Bus Route 22 for transportation between Roxbury Crossing and Ruggles.

attributes.description:
Orange Line: Bus shuttle is available upon request to or from Ruggles and Jackson.

Request the shuttle from an MBTA employee or station call box. These elevators are closed through Fall 2020.

Traveling to Ruggles: 
Riders looking to travel to Ruggles should take the train to Jackson Square where a shuttle bus will bring them to Ruggles. The Jackson Square shuttle pick-up location is in the busway adjacent to the station entrance to the mezzanine.

Traveling from Ruggles:
Riders looking to board at Ruggles can use a shuttle bus to Jackson Square or accessible van service in the cul-de-sac adjacent to the station entrance on Forsyth St. The elevator bus pick-up location is in the Ruggles Upper Busway. Riders boarding the accessible van at the Forsyth St. entrance may be transported directly to Jackson Square Station upon request.

Affected elevators:
Elevator 850 Orange Line platform to upper lobby
Elevator 851 Forsyth St to upper lobby
attributes.header: There is no elevator access at Ruggles from the Orange Line or Forsyth St (Northeastern Campus) while the elevators are being replaced. Bus shuttles are available for passengers traveling to or from Ruggles. Access is available from Commuter Rail.
attributes.short_header: There is no elev. access at Ruggles from the Orange Ln or Forsyth St while the elevators are being replaced.

attributes.header: Route 86: Beginning Friday 11/13/2020, bus stops at Washington St @ Leland St and Perry St in Somerville will be eliminated as part of the Rapid Response Bus Lane project on Washington St. Nearest stops: Washington St @ Calvin St / Dane St. or Parker St.

attributes.description: Weekday Hingham/Hull service will operate with reduced frequency. A total of 17 weekday trips to Boston will make stops from Hingham to Long Wharf (nine trips directly to Long Wharf with two trips also stopping at Hull for a total of 11) and from Hull to Long Wharf (six direct trips total) with the first trip from Hingham at 5:40 AM, the first trip from Hull at 6 AM, the last trip from Hingham at 7 PM, and the last trip from Hull at 4:20 PM. Seventeen weekday return trips to Hingham/Hull will make stops between Long Wharf, Hull, and Hingham with the first trip from Long Wharf to Hingham at 6:30 AM and the last trip between Long Wharf, Hull, and Hingham at 8 PM. There will be no weekend service. Visit MBTA.com/forgingahead for more information.
attributes.header: Effective January 23, Weekday Hingham/Hull service will operate with reduced frequency and direct service from Hingham to Rowes Wharf will be temporarily suspended.

attributes.description:
All bus shuttles will be free and ADA accessible, but bikes will not be allowed on board buses.

Note that additional weekdays may be added to the shuttle busing as work progresses. 

Visit MBTA.com/PTC for more information on how this project will improve Commuter Rail safety and travel. 


Affected stops:
North Billerica
Lowell
attributes.header: From Monday, Feb 8th, through Friday, Feb 26th, buses will replace all Lowell Line trains between North Billerica and Lowell to allow for PTC work. Buses will depart Lowell 10 minutes prior to train schedule.

attributes.description:
Morning Inbound Bus Stops Time
Rockport Commuter Rail Station
5:18 AM
Gloucester Commuter Rail Station
5:30 AM
Beverly Commuter Rail Station
5:55 AM

Evening Outbound Bus Stops Time
Beverly Commuter Rail Station
5:10 PM
Gloucester Commuter Rail Station**
5:35 PM
Rockport Commuter Rail Station**
5:47 PM

**Drop off on demand only

Service operates weekdays only. The bus stops at Rockport, Gloucester, and Beverly Commuter Rail Stations only.
-This is a pilot program, subject to cancellation at any time.
-There will be no fare charged on the CATA bus during the pilot. Times will be adjusted as needed.
-Customers are reminded that face coverings or masks are required while using public transportation.
attributes.header: CATA provides weekday commuter bus service to/from Beverly to meet with inbound Train 7150 (6:03am from Beverly) and outbound Train 1157 (5:05pm at Beverly).
